State Sen: Paul Bettencourt, R-Houston, claimed that his move in 2015 stopped a $100 million tax increase in the Dallas school district.
Bettencourt offered a revision to a meas: Brandon Creighton, R-Conroe, which imposed a higher voting threshold for "local taxing units to assess property tax increases in their jurisdictions."
The new state law required a 60 percent: whereas prior to 2015, only a majority vote was required.
